references.paper_title: Mastering the game of Go with deep neural networks and tree search
references.reason: This paper introduced AlphaGo, a groundbreaking AI that defeated a world champion Go player, demonstrating the power of combining deep learning with reinforcement learning for game playing.

references.paper_title: Mastering Chess and Shogi by Self-Play with a General Reinforcement Learning Algorithm
references.reason: This paper introduced AlphaZero, which surpassed the performance of existing specialized game-playing AIs by using a general reinforcement learning algorithm and self-play.

references.paper_title: Mastering Atari, Go, Chess and Shogi by Planning with a Learned Model
references.reason: This paper introduced MuZero, which extended the AlphaZero approach to learn game strategies without explicit knowledge of the game rules, showing significant progress in general AI.
This paper introduced Graph Attention Networks (GATs), a novel type of neural network architecture that operates on graph-structured data, which is crucial for AlphaGateau’s approach.

references.paper_title: Train on Small, Play the Large: Scaling Up Board Games with AlphaZero and GNN
references.reason: This paper explored using Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) to scale up AlphaZero to different board sizes, directly inspiring the work done in this paper.
